Class AI

java.lang.Object
com.example.miniproyecto3.model.players.PlayerAdapter
com.example.miniproyecto3.model.players.AI
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPlayer, Serializable
public class AI extends PlayerAdapter implements Serializable
Represents the computer-controlled opponent in the game. The AI uses basic logic to randomly select cells and prioritize adjacent cells when a ship is hit, simulating a slightly smarter behavior based on difficulty. The AI maintains a List of pending target coordinates to simulate strategy, and can adjust its difficulty level to affect behavior. This class is Serializable to support saving and restoring game state.
Since:
version 3.0
Version:
3.0
Author:
David Taborda Montenegro.

  • Constructor Details

    • AI

      public AI(int score, String name, String difficulty)
      Constructs a new AI player with initial score, name, and difficulty level.
      Parameters:
      score - the starting score for the machine.
      name - the name of the machine player.
      difficulty - the difficulty level that the machine will have.

  • Method Details

    • makeMove

      public boolean makeMove(int row1, int col1, Board opponentBoardModel, List<Ship> opponentShips)
      Executes a move using the AI's decision-making strategy. The AI will select a pending adjacent target (if available), or choose a random untargeted cell. If a hit is successful, adjacent cells are listed as new targets. If a ship is sunk, the list is cleared.
      Specified by:
      makeMove in interface IPlayer
      Overrides:
      makeMove in class PlayerAdapter
      Parameters:
      row1 - ignored (not used by AI).
      col1 - ignored (not used by AI).
      opponentBoardModel - the opponent's logic board model.
      opponentShips - the opponent's ships.
      Returns:
      True if the move hits a ship or false otherwise.

    • makeRandomMove

      public boolean makeRandomMove(Board opponentBoardModel, List<Ship> opponentShips)
      Performs a purely random move, independent of strategic targeting.
      Parameters:
      opponentBoardModel - the opponent's logic board.
      opponentShips - the list of opponent ships.
      Returns:
      True if the move hits a ship, or false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • Ship

    • getDifficulty

      public int getDifficulty()
      Returns the numeric difficulty level of the AI.
